results.name: Mirror image of (denominators of) Bernoulli tree, A106831.
comment: In contrast to A106831 which follows Woon's original indexing (and orientation), this variant starts with value a(0) = 1, with the rest of terms having an index incremented by one, thus allowing for a simple recurrence.
Sequence contains only terms of A001013 and each a(n) is a multiple of A246660(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16383
S. C. Woon, A tree for generating Bernoulli numbers, Math. Mag., 70 (1997), 51-56.
Index entries for sequences related to Bernoulli numbers.
formula: a(0) = 1; and for n > 0, if n is even, a(n) = 2*a(n/2), and if n is odd, a(n) = (A001511(n+1)+1-A036987(n)) * a((n-1)/2).
example: This sequence can be represented as a binary tree:
program: A106831r1(n) = if(!n,1,if(n%2, 2*A106831r1((n-1)/2), (1+A001511(n))*A106831r1(n/2))); \\ Recurrence for A106831, when prepended with 1, thus shifted one term right
xref: Cf. A106831 and also A005940, A283477, A322827 for other similar trees.
